event.title: Last.fm DJ Team

artists.artist: Acid Mothers Temple &Amp; The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.

event.description:
A night to remember...

“When was rock’n’roll ever meant to be comfortable?” asked Julian Cope in reference to Japanese genre-mashers Acid Mothers Temple. He’s right, and AMT proved it last night at our second live event at The Old Blue Last, destroying ear drums, smashing through everyone’s expectations and blowing up the boundaries between dive-bomb psychedelia, heavy riffage, and coruscating improvisation. It was an experience.

The place was filled with AMT freaks, kids getting their first fix of this sound, and loyal fans who’ve been following this collective since they started back in the ‘70s (in testament to their longevity, the AMT merchandise stall was laden with endless obscure CDs and DVDs from the band’s career that you wouldn’t be able to find anywhere else, rich pickings for the faithful)

event.title: SSS
event.description:
Thanks for coming out!

There are people missing from the Last.fm office today. Some didn't survive the moshpit that erupted as <a href="/music/SSS" title="SSS">SSS</a> brought their flashbomb thrash to our second ever live event at the <a href="/venue/8777933" title="Old Blue Last">Old Blue Last</a> on Saturday. We would mourn, but quite frankly weÕre still reeling from an evening of metal mayhem, sci fi drum madness and punishing
electro-noise.

We took over the Vice pub in East London in the early evening on Saturday, and had to pull the plug in the early hours of Sunday when the police descended to tell us off for being too loud. (They shouldÕve been upstairs when <a href="/music/Errorplains" title="Errorplains">Errorplains</a> kicked off with a wall of FX-pedal noise. Now that was loud.)

In between the smashÕnÕgrab metal of <a href="/music/SSS" title="SSS">SSS</a> and the synth assault of <a href="/music/Errorplains" title="Errorplains">Errorplains</a>, crazy drum maestro <a href="/music/Duracell" title="Duracell">Duracell</a> played a rare UK live set. If you havenÕt seen this guy before, he manages to produce entire sets of future-music using just a drum set, trigger machine and a laptop. Never has a man been so sweaty as <a href="/music/Duracell" title="Duracell">Duracell</a> was by the time his incredible one-man beat-symphony came to an end.

Downstairs was equally rammed, as punters wigged out to our very own Last.fm DJs, and the deck-wrecking moves of <a href="/music/Tapedeck+DJs" title="Tape Deck DJs">Tape Deck</a>, Shitting Fists and <a href="/music/People+Are+Germs" title="People Are Germs">People Are Germs</a>. By the end of the night the walls were dripping and bouncers were holding back a multitude outside. <a href="http://blog.last.fm/2007/10/17/lastfm-presents-at-the-old-blue-last"; title="Last.fm Blog">Read more about this event</a>

event.title: It's Automatic
event.description:
A brand new club night dedicated to all things italo/cosmic-flavoured, whether it be electro, techno, house, pop, synth or just plain old disko.

Residents are Last.fm stalwarts grazziee (Grazie), mknx (DJ Polipo) and sharevari (European Man). For the inaugural night, extra special guest is italo aficionado and cassette enthusiast PinkCutter a.k.a. Love's Tru Flavour.

Sadly Ali Renault can no longer make it due to a misunderstanding about the date. Doh. :(

event.title: Hot Chip DJs

artists.artist: The Last.fm User Generated DJ Team

event.description:
Thanks for coming out!

Back in the early zeroes, two of the three founders of Last.fm used to put on events at The Spitz, an East London venue thatÕs been showcasing new bands almost as long as Spitalfields has had a market (which is 369 years, fact fans). Then they got distracted by all this web start-up malarkey.

But on the 11th September 2007 they returned Ð with the rest of us, plus five amazing bands, our finest Last.fm deck-wreckers, and special guest DJs Hot Chip.

Altogether, we rocked the place and in the process raised £1,600 on the door alone (not to mention the bar which was practically drunk dry!). Anyway enough typing check out the footage below for yourselves...

event.title: TENORI-ON Exclusive Worldwide Launch Party
event.description:
Yamaha proudly unveil brand new and visually stunning performance instrument:

TENORI-ON

EXCLUSIVE LAUNCH EVENT AT PHONICA RECORDS / VINYL FACTORY, LONDON

TUESDAY 4TH SEPTEMBER 2007
18:00 - 23:00 FREE

Featuring talks, performances and DJ sets from:

Robert Lippok (To Rococo Rot), Toshio Iwai (Media Artist), Secondo (Dreck Records), Capracara (Soul Jazz Records) + More.

This September Yamaha proudly launch the TENORI-ON, a brand new and visually stunning performance instrument at a worldwide exclusive at London's premier independent record shop Phonica Records. This event will not only feature TENORI-ON performances from some of the finest talent in electronic music but also an introduction and discussion with the TENORI-ON’s inventor.

The TENORI-ON is a unique 16 x 16 LED button matrix performance instrument with a stunning visual display. For DJs & producers it is a unique performance tool enabling them create spectacular live & DJ audio-visual performances.

Conceived by leading Japanese media artist Toshio Iwai in 2001 and following five years of intensive development. The TENORI-ON has been showcased ad refined at major music events and media art festivals; Sonar (Spain), Futuresonic (U.K), Ars Electronica (Austria), SIGGRAPH (U.S), Art Futura (Spain) and more, as well as being road tested by cutting edge electronic music artists: Kraftwerk, Yellow Magic Orchestra, Matthew Herbert, Mouse On Mars, Cornelius, To Rococo Rot, Jim O’ Rourke, Rei Harakami, Taylor Deupree, Tortoise and Atom Heart. The TENORI-ON is one of the most innovative and exciting new instruments to be released by Yamaha for many years.

The launch event will see inventor Toshio Iwai talk and answer questions on the TENORI-ON plus live performances from a selection of artists lucky enough to be asked to road test this exciting new instrument.

Flying in from Berlin To Rococo Rot’s Robert Lippok will perform an exclusive UK set alongside cutting edge disco edit maestro Secondo (Dreck Records) and the man dubbed ‘the savior of acid house’ Capracara (Soul Jazz Records) + a DJ set from Duodecimo.

Full Event Details:
Venue: Vinyl Factory below Phonica Records, 51 Poland Street, London, W1F, 7RJ (please use main shop entrance).
- Time: 18.00 – 23.00
- Free Entry – Please arrive early to avoid disappointment!

event.title: Tales Of The Jackalope
event.description:
<p>
<h2>The Tales…</h2>
</p>
<p>
2006 saw the debut of Tales of the Jackalope. A unique festival concept created to house the best 24 hour music experience of the British summer set in a beautiful location.
</p>
<p>
Jackalope’s aim is to offer music lovers and anyone who simply enjoys having a good time the most imaginative and exciting music program in the country. Tales of the Jackalope 2006 saw key early performances from many of 2007’s biggest bands such as:
</p>
<p>
<b>THE KLAXONS, THE HORRORS, NEW YOUNG PONY CLUB,
GOOD SHOOES, JUSTICE</b>
</p>
<p>
These up-and-comers were mixed with a number of well-known headline acts including:
</p>
<p>
<b>THE MISFITS, SOULWAX, 2MANYDJS, MYLO</b>
</p>
<p>
This year, Tales of the Jackalope will take place on August 4th in the stunning grounds of Kimberley Hall, South Norfolk. Expect more than 60 acts over 5 areas!! So get ready for another 24 hours of madness mixed with the finest in music…. Line-up will be updated weekly so keep checking in or sign up for our blog, which will give you the latest updates about bands, competitions and other treats.</p>
<h3>Festival Playlist</h3>
<p>

</p>
<p> </p>

event.title: Ninja Tune & Last.fm party
event.description:
Last.fm creates ‘user-generated club’ with Ninja Tune

Tracks DJed will be chosen according to attendees’ music taste

Social music network Last.fm has teamed up with seminal label Ninja Tune to create a groundbreaking ‘user-generated’ club night at The Big Chill House on Pentonville Road on June 2nd.

All Last.fm users going to the party will help decide the setlist for the upstairs room, DJed by Ninja Tune’s Sparky. They’ll register their intention to attend at the club’s event page on the Last.fm website, and on the night Sparky will play tracks drawn from music listened to by those users in the preceding weeks.

Last.fm is a social music network that tracks what you listen to on your PC and iPod and then plays you new music that suits your taste, based on recommendations drawn from the listening habits of over 20 million active users.

This party is the first time that Last.fm has taken its ‘collaborative filtering’ ethos out into the real world. Sparky’s user-generated set will also be recorded and made available on Last.fm for users unable to attend.

Last.fm is also extremely chuffed that the youngest DMC World Champion to date and celebrated member of the Invisibl Skratch Piklz, the one and only A-Trak will be gracing the downstairs decks. Joining him is ingenious prodigy MC Kid Sister.

And if that wasn’t enough, Ninja Tune managed to get the hottest beatboxer of the moment to do a very special set of itches, scratches, and a lot of beard-inspired utterances into the mic. Behold the genious of Beardyman!

Furthermore, Ninja Tune will bring their very own Mr Herbaliser Ollie Teeba along to entice the dancing crowds. And last but by no earthly measures least, the striped-jumper-wearing godfather of warm and soulful sounds, London’s very own Ross Allen will also be heating up the dance floor.

MAIN ROOM
Ollie Teeba 9-10
Beardyman 10-11
A-Trak 11-12.30
Kid Sister 12.30-1am
Ross Allen 1-4am

UPSTAIRS
(Last.fm hosting)
DJ Sparky 9-4

IT'S FREE BEFORE 9PM AND ONLY £5 AFTER - amazing value for your hard earned money! Just make sure you squeeze in before they have to shut the doors, cause oh my gosh it will be rammed! ;)

event.title: Meat Raffle
event.description:
with DJs:

Erik Jälevik (LastFM!)
Meaty Milan
16oz Stewart
Baby Face Dave

The Meat Raffle Soundsystem has been asked once again by The Lock Tavern to curate a bank holiday's worth of mutant disco, acid house, electropop and partytronica, lasting all the way from 3pm until closing!

Joining us will be Kitsunen wonderboys Punks Jump Up, remixers of Robyn, Lo-Fi-Fnk and Simian Mobile Disco amongst others, and Last FM's Italo-king Erik Jälevik.

As ever, Meaty Milan, 16oz Stewart and Baby Face Dave will be eating roasts and filling in the gaps.

http://www.myspace.com/punksjumpup

http://www.myspace.com/meatraffleclub

Monday 28th May * 3pm - 11pm.
at The Lock Tavern, Chalk Farm Road, Camden
Nearest tube - Camden Town or Chalk Farm

event.title: Discombabulate
event.description:
Sound Stream

Discombabulate 5
17 May 2007
Plastic People
£6

For the next instalment of Disco-bobbles we have secured the services of everybody's favourite Berliner Frank Timm aka Soundstream aka Soundhack aka one half of Smith n Hack.

Having played the first ever Discombabulate under his Soundhack guise, this time he returns for some mesmerisingly live and loopy disco action in the form of Soundstream. Anyone who owns one of the extremely hot Soundstream 12"s will be smitten by Frank's unique and visionary take on some of the finest vintage disco ever made. Another quality Discombabulate night - rare, quick, on a Thursday night and not to be missed.

Tickets available from Sounds of the Universe and Ticketweb.

event.description:
The 3rd SonicRecycler; an amazing mix of live acts, films and DJs. curated by si-cut.db / douglas benford (possibly DJing; let see how i feel!)
see http://www.myspace.com/sonicrecycler
ROTHKO, BODUF SONGS, STEPHAN MATHIEU, DAVID CUNNINGHAM, BIRD BY SNOW are the live acts. C.Eymenier (with soundtrack by FENNESZ),
Janek Schaefer, People like Us, U-Sun (with a soundtrack by PIMMON) and Semiconductor are showing their films.
** NB FENNESZ & PIMMON are NOT live, but it is their (exclusive London debuts) soundtracks with two films. (lengths: Fennesz: 20 mins, Pimmon: 10 mins). Stephan Mathieu is also showing a film.

Tickets at http://www.wegottickets.com/event/16734

event.title: Philip Jeck
event.description:
Fear of Jazz is the new home of musical adventure and exploration in London. The shows will be highlighting those musicians not afraid of finding new ways to bring music to the people. Improvisation will be high on the agenda, as will a friendly atmosphere where folk can share their ideas, listen and be heard.
ENTRY £6 - no pre sales.

event.title: SOTTOVOCE - a DIY day festival on noise and improv
event.description:
'SOTTO VOCE'[br] ('whispering', or a dual reference to a 'discrete', 'underground' voice) as an attempt to reflect the ethos and the DIY nature of the event in all senses.

2 alternating spaces: one amplified and one 'self resonating' at the state51 warehouse (aka, 'the factory') in London's East End (off Bricklane yet off the Shoreditch path).

This event will include the first UK performances of AUFGEHOBEN and TESTICLE HAZARD (Lass Marhaug and Tommi Keranen), rare London appearances by GARY SMITH and ROGER TURNER, new projects by RHODRI DAVIES, and more.

event.title: Bleep Christmas Party
event.description: Bleep Christmas party at The Salisbury, N4. NB Hot Chip is DJ set only, still tbc! Also playing are Moshi Moshi Records Djs, Soul Jazz Djs.

event.title: Lawrence
event.description:
Süd’s Yuletide Knees Up - Dial Records Allnighter

Line up Overview + Venue Details
15th December 2006

Room 1
Dj's
Lawrence / Sten ( Dial , Kompakt , Cocoon , Novamute , Ghostly/Spectral , Ladomat )
Carsten Jost ( Dial , Klang Elektronik , Sender )

Live
Pantha Du Prince ( Dial )

Support Dj's
Juergen Junker ( Neurhythmics , Third Ear )
Lakuti ( Süd )

Room 2

Nick Craddock (nickcraddock.co.uk)
Marco Shuttle ( Minisketch , Multivitamins)
Stefano

Venue : The Rhythm Factory 16 - 18 Whitechapel Road , London E1 1EW
Click on the link below for a map
www.multimap.com/map/browse.cgi?lat=51.5167&lon=-0.0676&scale=10000&icon=x
Nearest Tubes : Aldgate East , Whitechapel
Buses : 67 , 25 , 205 , 254 , 25 , N106 , N253
Times : 10 pm - 6am
Door Charge : £10 / £8 Concessions to Süd's mailinglist subscribers . Subscribe by emailing :
info@sudelectronic.com
Infoline : 07727685791
www.sudelectronic.com


Now in it's 4th year . The Süd's end of the year party is always about fun . This is the one we usually look forward to & this year's will be no exception . With the best line up yet , this one is not to be missed ! :)

Forget , mince pies , overcooked turkey & brussel sprouts , . Great electronic music will be on offer on this occassion .

We are so so pleased to be joined , by Hamburg's , finest , Dial Records , for their first ever 'Dial Records Allnighter ' ; in London .There is no guessing then that Dial is somewhat of an obsession down our headquarters . They are one of those labels , that never ever get it wrong . Now on their 31st release ; they are all about really intricate productions , melody , lush & beautiful compositions & great techno . The Dial artists are also in demand when it comes to remix work . Having remixed Depeche Mode's Martin L. Gore (Lawrence ) ; Depeche Mode themselves , (Pantha Du Prince ) , Actress , Audision , Turner , Ego Express e.t.c. Head honchos , Lawrence & Carsten Jost , & Pantha Du Prince , will be taking over Room 1 of the Rhythm Factory . Lakuti will be joined by Juergen Junker , on warm up duties . Juergen Junker has delivered some great records on his Neurhythmics imprint and has featured , on remix duties , on the seminal 'Detroit Beatdown Remixes' , (Third Ear ) remixing Delano Smith's 'Metropolis' . Having played nights such as 'Lost' e.t.c. He used to be the friendly face at Smallfish records too ! :)

Room 2 will be hosted by Süd residents Nick Craddock & Marco Shuttle . These guys have been more than impressive this year . Stealing the thunder from guests on many occassions . They will be joined by a special friend to Süd ; Stefano . The party is not a party without Stefano , in fact he has hosted many a Süd afterparty :) Stefano has such a vast knowledge of electronic music , not to mention a vast collection , so his
Süd debut , should be magical then ! :)

Dial Records are renowned for the exceptional artwork on their records too , with David Lieske's ( Carsten Jost ) , growing reputation in the Contemporary circles in Germany . They will be working with our very own Brittski , in bringing us some wonderful visual work on the night .

Not to be missed !

More info from :
http://www.dial-rec.de/
http://www.smallville-records.de
http://www.panthaduprince.com/
http://www.myspace.com/lawrencesten
http://www.myspace.com/carstenjost


Hope to see you there !

event.title: Black Devil Disco Club
event.description:
The fourth edition of Discombabulate will present an absolute first, an exclusive analogue live performance by one of the undisputed pioneers of Italo Disco, the Black Devil.

In 1978 French library writer Bernard Fevre aka 'Black Devil' released the now classic and very hard to find 'Disco Club’ on Out Records, a masterpiece of electronic disco and a precursor to the soon to follow Italo Disco movement. What Liaison Dangereuse is to Detroit Techno, Black Devil is to Italo Disco.

A set of re-issues by Rephlex records in 2004 made this seminal work available to a wider audience and London's Lo Recordings released the follow-up '28 After', which is out now.

Get your roller-skates on and arrive early to avoid disappointment!
